alert.note: Alert for Cass; Marion (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued August 22 at 9:00PM CDT until August 26 at 1:00PM CDT by NWS Shreveport
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Texas... Black Cypress Bayou At Jefferson affecting Marion and Cass Counties. For the Black Cypress Bayou...including Jefferson...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM THURSDAY MORNING TO EARLY FRIDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Black Cypress Bayou At Jefferson. * WHEN...From Thursday morning to early Friday afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 13.0 feet, Lowland flooding will affect mainly timber resources. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:00 PM CDT Monday the stage was 7.4 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 13.0 feet Thursday morning. It will then fall below flood stage Thursday evening. - Flood stage is 13.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 13.6 feet on 12/23/2013. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Do not drive cars through flooded areas. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. For more hydrologic information, copy and paste the following website address into your favorite web browser URL bar: water.weather.gov/ahps2/index.php?wfo=shv The next statement will be issued Tuesday evening at 900 PM CDT.
